definition: obedient/to comply/to submit/to defer
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
surname Cong

sentences.english: She is an obedient girl and always obeys her parents.
sentences.chinese: 她是個順從的孩子，總是服從父母。

sentences.english: Then Peter and the other apostles answered and said, We ought to obey God rather than men.
sentences.chinese: 彼得和衆使徒回答說，順從神，不順從人，是應當的。

sentences.english: Then Peter and the other apostles answered and said, We ought to obey God rather than men.
sentences.chinese: 彼得和衆使徒回答說，順從神，不順從人，是應當的。

sentences.english: An act or instance of cringing.
sentences.chinese: 帶有媚態和奉承的順從。

sentences.english: In the code of military etiquette silence and fixity are forms of deference.
sentences.chinese: 在軍事禮節的符號中，沉默和固定是順從的表示。

sentences.english: "Acceptance of the present moment has nothing to do with resignation," writes Kabat-Zinn.
sentences.chinese: “接受當下時刻與順從無關，”卡巴金寫道。

sentences.english: They never become submissive like dogs and horses.
sentences.chinese: 它們從不像狗和馬一樣變得那麼順從。

sentences.english: This was no grim duty to which I stoically resigned, however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這並非我須堅忍順從的痛苦職責。

sentences.english: Let us not be obedient onoccasion.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們不要只在某些場合順從。

sentences.english: Without giving it any further thought, the obedient subjects followed their king's orders.
sentences.chinese: 沒有多想一想，順從的猴子們遵循了猴王的指示。

sentences.english: And sometimes, if cats are expecting to be fed and the owner isn't obeying, the cat may swat.
sentences.chinese: 有時，如果貓期望餵食但貓奴沒有順從，貓可能亂抓。

sentences.english: The one-eyed man obeyed the obedient audience' s order.
sentences.chinese: 獨眼人服從了順從的聽衆的命令。

sentences.english: they never become submissive like dogs and horses.
sentences.chinese: 它們從不象狗和馬一樣變得那麼順從。
又一次，傑維斯默默地順從了。

sentences.english: Foreigners came cringing to me; as soon as they heard of me, they obeyed me.
sentences.chinese: 外邦人要投降我，一聽見我的名聲就必順從我。

sentences.english: Frequently looking down can indicate submissiveness or embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 低頭往下看通常都表示順從或不好意思。

definition: bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
to blame/to criticize/condemnation/reproach
to listen and obey/to comply with/to heed/to hearken
resentful/angry/to enrage sb
to go against/to be contrary to/to violate
absolutely unrestrained/unbridled/without the slightest scruple
to blame/to rebuke
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to be afraid
to drift apart/to become estranged/to alienate/estrangement
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
doctrine/dogma/creed/dogmatic
willingly
stubborn/willful/pigheaded/Taiwan pr. [zhi2 ao4]
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
